divs: Sighting DetailsI look at the sky from time to time but notice a slight flashing star (so i thought), than thought it was an air plane than possibly the space station. All of these possibilities were ruled out after some research, as an airplane doesn't hover or go backwards diagonal so quickly etc. The space station moves faster and usually in an east to west flight. This object flashes randomly and moves very randomly. It looks as if a flashing laser pointer is being pointed into the sky. Its movements are not graceful and very erratic. i watched it for almost 4hrs (not knowing how much time has passed) Had to get to bed but see it every night around 1am when the sky is clear. i plan to break out the telescope tonight to get a better look.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Marbury
This sighting has never been favorited.
Object Flight Path: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
Summary: Has been seen every night (with no cloud cover) for a week now and starts around 1 am all through the night (until i pass out and stop watching it). Stays in same general area. Moves like a hummingbird would or laser pointer (best analogy i can give)
